products.title: CNC Kitchen Threaded Insert M2 / M2.5 / M3 / M4 / M5 / M6 / M8 / M10 / 1.4"
products.body_html:
CNC Kitchen's threaded inserts are engineered specifically for FDM 3D printed parts, ensuring durable and reliable screw threads. These inserts maintain the strength and functionality of your prints through multiple assembly cycles, preventing wear and damage. When paired with CNC Kitchen's Soldering Tips, they provide precise and secure joining, ideal for professional-grade 3D printing projects. Available in sizes M2 to M10 and 1.4", G1/8-28x12.7, 3/8"-16x12.7 , they offer versatile compatibility for various applications.

10% off for bulk order (10+ items of CNC Kitchen Products - Mix and Match) - Auto Apply at cart/checkout

Features:

  • Made from a brass alloy that is completely free of lead and cadmium, ensuring environmental safety.
  • Genuine CNC Kitchen threaded inserts designed specifically for 3D printed materials such as PLA, PETG, ABS, and others.
  • Premium quality inserts that elevate your printed parts to a professional standard.
  • Accurately CNC machined inserts crafted from premium alloy free of lead and cadmium.
  • Simple installation using a soldering iron, set to the printing temperature plus 10 °C for optimal results.

Threaded inserts not only look great in 3D printed parts, but they also have a practical use. Everyone has had a device that was assembled with screws. After disassembling and reassembling it a few times, you realize that if the screws dug directly into the plastic, they won't hold anymore. Each time you screw the parts together, the material gets plastically deformed at the threads, which eventually leaves you with nothing but a ragged hole where nothing can grab. This is where thread inserts come into play. By melting them into your parts, they are positively bonded to the plastic and no longer move. The screws are now turned into durable and also low-friction brass and thus will last forever.

Package includes the following specific items:

  • All Size Set (760 pcs)
  • Set standard: M3x5,7 mm (100x); M4x8,1 mm (50x); M5x9,5 mm (50x) pcs
  • Set short: M3x3 mm (100x); M4x4 mm (50x); M5x5,8 mm (50x) pcs
  • M2 standard (100x) pcs
  • M2.5 standard (100x) pcs
  • M3 standard (100x) pcs
  • M3 short (100x) pcs
  • M4 standard (50x) pcs
  • M4 short (50x) pcs
  • M5 standard (50x) pcs
  • M5 short (50x) pcs
  • M6 (20x) pcs
  • M8 (20x) pcs
  • 1/4" (20x) pcs
  • G1/8-28x12.7 (20x) pcs
  • 3/8"-16x12.7 (20x) pcs
  • M10 (20x) pcs

Note: For the larger M10 and above sizes, you would need additional copper tips in additional to soldering iron tip pack for your iron, for collection of compatible and customised made install tips. See CNC Kitchen collection for range of supported soldering irons. 

Documentation: 

  • TIPS & TRICKS FOR HEAT-SET INSERTS USED IN 3D PRINTING
  • CAD FILES
  • HOW TO USE HEAT INSERTS IN RESIN
  • TESTING VIDEO BY TOM SANLADERER

Installation

Heat-set inserts can be installed by pressing them into the plastic using a soldering iron. The plastic melts and flows around the knurled exterior of the insert, forming a robust bond that provides excellent pull-out and torque resistance. When heating your soldering iron, set the temperature to the filament’s printing temperature plus an additional 10°C to 20°C for optimal results.

 

Hole Dimensions

Refer to the drawing below for the recommended hole dimensions for the insert. The hole should be sized to allow easy insertion of the insert while ensuring no burrs remain beneath it after melting.

products.title: Panchroma™ Matte PLA (Formerly PolyTerra™ PLA) Filament 1.75mm 1kg
products.body_html:
In 2025, PolyTerra PLA™ will be rebranded to become Panchroma™ Matte PLA. 

PolyTerra™ PLA is a matte surface PLA-based 3D printing filament with a huge range of colours and effects to choose from. It is a sustainably sourced formula developed to be easy to print with great bridging & overhang capability. It can print in a very wide temperature window and is compatible with most extrusion-based 3D printers.

This spool does fit in the A1 / X1 AMS system.

Density: 1.37g/cm³

  • Matte Surface & Fun Colours - Print parts with a beautiful matte surface finish and unleash your imagination with PolyTerra™ PLA's fun and vibrant colour range. PolyTerra™ PLA renders models with excellent surface quality and features great overhang and bridging capability.
  • Optimized for Support - PolyTerra™ PLA has been engineered with excellent support removal properties, enabling users to more easily break away support or rafts from the surface of their prints.
  • Easy Sanding - PolyTerra™ PLA is softer and easier to sand in comparison to regular PLA filaments and can be easily painted.
  • High Speed Capable - Polymaker have engineered the base PolyTerra™ PLA formula with ideal flow properties to deliver a filament which is capable of high speed printing (only on suitable hardware)
  • Bioplastic Matte PLA Formula - PolyTerra™ PLA is based on a newly developed material from Polymaker called FBC (Fully Bio Compound). It is a compound of high quality Ingeo PLA compounded with naturally occurring elements. The result is a PLA filament with less plastic content that feels softer and more ductile / less brittle on the spool. Polymakers FBC formula contains less PLA plastic to degrade which improves the speed of degradation under specific industrial conditions. Like other PLA's, the degradation rate is still very slow in ambient temperatures.
  • Ductility (X-Y) - PolyTerra™ PLA is softer than regular PLA, delivering improved ductility in the horizontal X-Y axis than standard PLA formulations. Whereas a test bar in standard PLA will snap when bent, PolyTerra™ PLA will tend to gradually bend and fracture in the horizontal axis.
  • Improved Ductility - PolyTerra™ PLA delivers improved ductility which is less brittle (Charpy Impact) in X-Y axis than standard PLA formulations.
  • Compatibility / Jam-Free™- PolyTerra™ PLA is compatible with a wide range of 3D printers and is manufactured with Polymakers  Jam-Free™ technology which leads to excellent printing quality with zero risk of nozzle jams caused by heat creep [1]. PolyTerra™ PLA works well on many printing surfaces with a thin layer of glue stick applied, no heated bed is required but can be used at 40 - 50°C for better results (maximum 60°C).
  • Uncompromised Quality - PolyTerra™ PLA filament is made with the highest quality ingredients including Ingeo® from Natureworks; a high quality PLA material produced from rapidly renewable plant resources in the US. Combining Polymakers innovative R&D technologies, compounding and extrusion systems with Natureworks Ingeo® resins produces a reliable 3D printing filament to print beautiful and accurate models.

[1] Heat creep is the the process of heat spreading irregularly throughout the hot end, one common example is with all metal hot end designs. Once heat creeps towards the cold end, the PLA filament softens prematurely in the cold end and expands resulting in a jam. Polymakers Jam-Free™ technology increases the heat resistance of the filament itself (not the printed part) to 100˚C which prevents the filament from prematurely softening in the cold end and can still melt rapidly once entering the heating zone.

Printing Settings
Nozzle Temperature 190°C - 230°C
Build Plate Temperature 25°C - 60°C*

*You may find lower bed temperatures (i.e 45°C) work better with PolyTerra™ PLA in comparison to higher temperatures.
Build Surface Material Works well with most common build surfaces.
Build Surface Treatment Typically none required. Some surfaces such as glass work best with PVA glue stick.
Cooling Fan ON
Printing Speed 30 mm/s - 70 mm/s
Retraction The ideal retraction settings vary from printer to printer. If you find the retraction settings are causing gaps in your part, the following settings may help.
Direct Drive: Retraction distance of 0.5 - 1mm with retraction speed of 20mm/s
Bowden: Retraction distance of 2 - 3mm with retraction speed of 20 - 40mm/s
Recommended Support Material Single Extrusion:
Self Support

Dual Extrusion:
PolySupport™ (Easy break-away support material)

Based on 0.4 mm nozzle. Printing conditions may vary with different printers and nozzle diameters.

To produce flatter more dimensionally accurate parts, PolyTerra™ PLA may work best on your printer with lower bed temperatures (i.e 45 - 50°C) compared to higher temperatures (i.e 55 - 60°C +) . 

Specification
Net Weight 1kg
Material Type Matte PLA (Fully Bio Compound)
Density 1.31 g/cm3 
Other Features Polymakers Jam-Free™ Technology
Compatibility

PolyTerra™ PLA has been engineered with compatibility in mind to print excellently on a wide range of 3D printers. The Jam-Free™ technology implemented into PolyTerra™ PLA can improve compatibility with all metal hot end designs that suffer from heat creep.

Of course with thousands of unique 3d printer models on the market, we can't guarantee each filament type will work with every 3D printer.

products.title: Boron Nitride Paste 5CC - Slice Engineering
products.body_html:
Boron Nitride Paste is a specialist thermal interface compound designed for 3D printer heater cartridge installation. Applied to the cartridge heater hole in your heat block, it dramatically improves heat dissipation from the cartridge, extending component lifespan. Unlike conductive anti-seize compounds, boron nitride's non-conductive properties eliminate the risk of electrical shorts to your heater or thermistor. Rated stable to 850 °C in air and 1800 °C in vacuum, it's engineered for demanding thermal management in hotend assemblies like Mosquito® and Copperhead® systems.

  • Thermal paste for improving conduction

  • Acts as a release agent

  • Unlike anti-seize compounds, Boron Nitride is not electrically conductive, which eliminates the risk of shorting out your heater cartridge or thermistor

  • Use the included applicator to coat the cartridge heater hole in your 3d printer heat block. Insert the cartridge heater while the paste is still wet, then let dry. The boron nitride boosts dissipation of heat from the hot section of the cartridge heater, improving its life.

  • Retails in 5 cc syringes with luer lock fittings.

  • Stable to 850 °C in air, 1800 °C in a vacuum. SDS available here. How to Apply

  • Boron Nitride Paste is the ideal potting agent when installing heaters and temperature sensors. Mosquito® and Copperhead® hot blocks use retaining screws to hold the heater and sensor in place instead of clamps (which can put unnecessary pressure on the cartridges and reduce their lifespan), requiring Boron Nitride Paste as a potting agent to hold the cartridges firmly in place.

Boron Nitride is so effective, that NASA is experimenting with it in high temperature applications on their spacecraft for the first manned mission to Mars. 

 

How is this related to 3D printing you may ask? 

Well, this paste elevates heat conduction between components, ensuring that your printer is working at maximum capacity, giving your hot block the even heat distribution it needs to deliver the highest quality print in the shortest amount of time. Also, unlike anti-seize compounds, Boron Nitride is not electrically conductive, which eliminates the risk of shorting out your heater cartridge or thermistor. 

The boron nitride particles in our compound are in an aqueous suspension. Once it’s heated, the liquid portion of the suspension evaporates, leaving behind a crumbly, clay-like paste. This paste has a tightly packed crystalline microstructure, and is extremely conductive (31.4 W/mK at 100 °C).

Those properties make it an ideal candidate for NASA, and an ideal candidate for your printer.

Bring a little space technology to your printer, and get better heat conduction.

products.body_html:

Note - board are pre-flashed with CANBUS or USB Firmware depending on variant selection so you may have to re-flash yourself to suit your installation if you wish to use in USB/CAN mode, instructions on how to do this are available at cartographer3d documentation site https://docs.cartographer3d.com

Specification:

What is included?

  • 1 x Can Cable - 20cm JST-PH to DuPont Cable PTFE Cable for CAN
  • 1 x USB Cable - 1.8m USB Cable (not cable chain rated, umbilical setup only)

Which version should I buy?

  • Low Profile Edition - Perfect for VzBot and RatRig Printers
  • Right Angle - TBC (Or you already know you need right angle variant) 
  • Flat Pack - Unsure right now? Maybe Flat Pack is the best option, assemble it as you wish when you decide what you want, and also if you don't feel comfortable with soldering would suggest selecting pre-solder in specific set-up above (depending on selection). 

Currently Cartographer do not support delta printers.

Documentation: 

Official: https://docs.cartographer3d.com

(Ensure you read through documentation, for any questions or concerns, feel free to reach out to us or join Cartographer Discord) 

For K1 Specific Guide: https://support.dremc.com.au/en/support/solutions/articles/51000437619-creality-k1-root-firmware-cartographer-

Note: Right angle PCB set-up, you may need flip/re-pin orientation of the USB wiring to match pin out on board to wiring pin out. Please double check out pin out especially if you're using your own wiring or modifying provided. 

CAN: 

It is recommended to run your CAN network at a baudrate of 1,000,000. 

Cartographer CAN Probe is recommended for use on BigTreeTech CAN Boards, it does and will work on Fly/Mellow & Fysetc Toolboards, but only BigTreeTech provide a CAN output, making wiring significantly easier. 

Note - We observed that some AFC-Lite Boards (Box Turtle controller) can output 24 Volt on CAN L/H lines (Carto runs at 5 volts) for unknown reason. Therefore we don't recommend running both on the same CAN network as there is a chance of frying your Cartographer. Running either over USB is fine or on different CAN networks. Its possible that your AFC-Lite is not affected and that there are other environmental variables at play.

Engineered to maximise hotend performance, this Bondtech CHT® RepRap M6 nozzle delivers enhanced thermal conductivity for accelerated print speeds without compromising quality. The coated brass construction strengthens inter-layer bonding, resulting in mechanically superior parts with improved durability and surface finish. Ideal for demanding applications where speed and structural integrity matter.

They are manufactured by Bondtech in-house, and will fit the following hotends/blocks:

Heat up the heat block up tp 280C, or at least above 250C, before removing or tightening any Bondtech CHT nozzle. Use at most 1.5 Nm torque.

  • Optimised for 1.75mm filament;
  • Compatible with 2.85mm filament.
  • Requires 6mm wrench

What is Included:

Pack of 5:

Main Advantages

  • Higher melt capacity by increasing the surface area of the heating walls
  • Affordable price
  • Machined with ultra-precision
  • Brass nozzle with Nickel coated surface
  • Follows the RepRap standard (M6×1×7.5×12.5)
  • May be used with 1.75 or 2.85mm hotends.

Check the White Paper:

"Increasing Melt Capacity With 3 Nozzle Features"

Advantages of the Bondtech CHT™ technology:

Bondtech CHT™ nozzles split the filament into 3 thinner strands allowing to melt the material from within. In doing so, the material melts faster and higher flow rates can be used.

Core Heating is a patented technology

  • In Europe : Registration number: EP3445568A1 : Publication Date: 2021-12-01
  • In the U.S. : Registration Number : US11712847B2 : Publication Date: 2023-08-01

Nozzles for 3D printers made of metal with at least one or a multitude of holes to increase the surface area of the heating walls.

Advantages of the Nickel Coating

Bondtech Coated Brass nozzles feature a Nickel plating that shields them from corrosion, erosion, and wear. This Nickel layer enhances corrosion resistance and reduces friction, resulting in smoother material flow and minimizing plastic buildup on the nozzle surface.


Recommended Materials

Use this nozzle with the following materials:

  • PLA
  • ABS
  • HIPS
  • PC
  • TPU
  • TPE
  • Nylon
  • PETG
  • ASA
  • PP
  • PVA

For technical and abrasive materials we recommend to use other nozzles in our range.

Different nozzle sets for different materials

We recommend you to have several sets of nozzles because:
Using different materials with the same nozzles causes deposit build-up inside the nozzle.
These deposits will cause blockages.
We recommend changing nozzles when changing materials.

products.title: Micro Swiss FlowTech™ Hotend for Creality K1 / K1 Max / K1C
products.body_html:
The FlowTech™ Hotend from Micro Swiss represents the latest advancement in hotend technology. Its innovative design addresses typical problems like nozzle seal leaks and complicated nozzle replacements.

True to Micro Swiss’s approach, the FlowTech hotend is engineered as a straightforward drop-in upgrade for specific 3D printer models. This version is compatible with the Creality K1 and K1 Max, maintaining the original z-height, build volume, and firmware settings.

Features:

  • Leak-Proof Nozzle:
    Tired of messy nozzle leaks that ruin your prints and waste filament? FlowTech Hotend combines nozzle and thermal break into one permanently sealed assembly that ensures a leak-proof hotend.

  • Cold Nozzle Change:
    Changing nozzles was traditionally a slow and potentially dangerous task. The FlowTech Hotend simplifies this process, allowing quick, one-handed nozzle swaps without the need for hot tightening.

  • High-Flow Characteristics:
    The ceramic cylindrical heater combined with a 28.6mm melt zone delivers an outstanding volumetric flow rate.

  • All-Metal Design:
    Engineered for longevity, the FlowTech hotend features an all-metal construction compatible with most current 3D printing filaments. Manufactured and assembled entirely in-house by Micro Swiss, it undergoes thorough quality inspections throughout production. Each hotend is also subjected to extensive thermal cycling testing before packaging to ensure performance and reliability.

  • 300°C Max Temperature:
    Rated for 300°C with a precisely calibrated NTC thermistor for each printer, this hotend version is specifically optimised for Creality K1 and K1 Max, eliminating the need for any firmware modifications.

Made in USA by Micro Swiss

Fit:

  • Creality K1
  • Creality K1 Max Older K1 Max and Newer K1 Max (2024/2025)

products.title: E3D V6 Nozzles
products.body_html:
V6 nozzles are designed for use with the E3D V6 heater block. Modify your HotEnd to be able to print with small nozzle orifices to achieve fine details or larger nozzle orifice sizes for more substantial, stronger prints. 1.75mm Brass V6 nozzles are fully compatible with the Prusa 3D printers.

Please note - V6 nozzles are not compatible with Volcano, SuperVolcano or Cyclops heater blocks.

Note: Sold Individually 

Choose the right material:

ObXidian 

ObXidian offers wear resistance far exceeding that of any other E3D nozzle, making it exceptionally durable. It is significantly harder than Nozzle X and all standard hardened steel nozzles. This superior hardness comes from combining a tool steel insert with our advanced E3DLC™ coating. Additionally, this unique coating provides built-in non-stick properties, greatly reducing plastic buildup on the nozzle.

Nozzle X

Nozzle X is designed to be the final nozzle your 3D printer will require. Constructed from hardened tool steel, it features a Nickel plating that preserves its hardness at high temperatures, and a WS2 coating to minimize material adhesion. Capable of withstanding temperatures up to 500°C, Nozzle X reliably handles every printable material*, from PLA to Carbon Fibre-filled PEEK, without experiencing wear.

Brass 

Brass nozzles with E3D’s distinctive internal design offer excellent thermal conductivity, ideal for routine printing tasks. They deliver smooth layer quality for standard, non-abrasive materials and are rated for temperatures up to 300°C.


Experimental Nozzles

Here be dragons! These nozzles conform to our strict manufacturing and engineering guidelines, but might still need more know-how and practice than others in our range. This collection includes high-resolution 0.15mm nozzles for very very tiny printing and also offer undrilled nozzles for those who like to make their own.

products.title: Polymaker PolyTerra™ Gradient PLA / Panchroma Matte Gradient PLA 1.75mm 1kg
products.body_html:
In 2025, PolyTerra Gradient Matte PLA™ will be rebranded to become Panchroma™ Gradient Matte PLA. You may received new packing/box depending on stock on hand. 

PolyTerra™ Gradient Matte PLA delivers a smooth matte surface finish, stunning rainbow gradient and is manufactured with Polymakers Jam-free™ technology.

Pastel Rainbow Colour Cycle: Approximately every 200g

Fall Colour Cycle: Approximately every 90g

Spring Colour Cycle: Approximately every 90g

Summer Colour Cycle: Approximately every 90g

Winter Colour Cycle: Approximately every 90g

  • Colourful pastel rainbow colour gradient transition.
  • Sustainable sourced Polymaker Matte PLA formula
  • Smooth matte surface finish.
  • Optimized for easier support removal.
  • High speed capable on suitable hardware.
  • Excellent printer compatibility.
  • Jam-free™ technology improves compatibility with all-metal hotends.
  • Sustainable cardboard spool & packaging.

Features

  • Gradient Transition - PolyTerra™ Gradient PLA combines the incredible matte surface finish of PolyTerra™ PLA with a series of stunning gradient colour transition filaments. Each gradient has been designed to focus on a specific theme or colour spectrum, delivering a fun filament for hobbyists, educators and small businesses. PolyTerra™ Gradient PLA is the perfect choice for printing dynamic and unique vases, artistic creation, statues and some articulated models.
  • Optimized for Support - PolyTerra™ Gradient PLA has been engineered with excellent support removal properties, enabling users to more easily break away support or rafts from the surface of their prints.
  • High Speed Capable - Polymaker have engineered the base PolyTerra™ PLA formula with ideal flow properties to deliver a filament which is capable of high speed printing (only on suitable hardware).
  • Bioplastic Matte PLA Formula - PolyTerra™ Gradient PLA is based on a newly developed material from Polymaker called FBC (Fully Bio Compound). It is a compound of high quality Ingeo PLA compounded with naturally occurring elements. The result is a PLA filament with less plastic content that feels softer and more ductile / less brittle on the spool. Polymakers FBC formula contains less PLA plastic to degrade which improves the speed of degradation under specific industrial conditions. Like other PLA's, the degradation rate is still very slow in ambient temperatures.
  • Ductility (X-Y) - PolyTerra™ Gradient PLA is softer than regular PLA, delivering improved ductility in the horizontal X-Y axis than standard PLA formulations. Whereas a test bar in standard PLA will snap when bent, PolyTerra™ Gradient PLA will tend to gradually bend and fracture in the horizontal axis.
  • Compatibility / Jam-Free™- PolyTerra™ Gradient PLA is compatible with a wide range of 3D printers and is manufactured with Polymakers Jam-Free™ technology which leads to excellent printing quality with zero risk of nozzle jams caused by heat creep [1]. PolyTerra™ Gradient PLA works well on most printing surface with a thin layer of glue stick applied, no heated bed is required but can sometimes be used at 40 - 50°C for better results (maximum 60°C).
  • Uncompromised Quality - PolyTerra™ Gradient PLA filament is made with the highest quality ingredients including Ingeo® from Natureworks; a high quality PLA material produced from rapidly renewable plant resources in the US. Combining Polymakers innovative R&D technologies, compounding and extrusion systems with Natureworks Ingeo® resins produces a reliable 3D printing filament to print beautiful and accurate models.

[1] Heat creep is the the process of heat spreading irregularly throughout the hot end, one common example is with all metal hot end designs. Once heat creeps towards the cold end, the PLA filament softens prematurely in the cold end and expands resulting in a jam. Polymakers Jam-Free™ technology increases the heat resistance of the filament itself (not the printed part) to 100˚C which prevents the filament from prematurely softening in the cold end and can still melt rapidly once entering the heating zone.

It is compatible with all current toolhead boards for SB and suitable for most community tool heads such as XOL, A4T or Dragon Burner.

products.title: Creality Universal Axial / Blower Fans (24v/12v) (30mm to 50mm) Replacement Kit
products.body_html:
This Creality Universal Fan Axial / Blower Fans Replacement Kit is designed for use with Creality 3D printers. Compatible with multiple sizes such as 3010,4010,4020,5015,5010 they come with both 24v and 12v options. 

Features: 

  • Easy replacement
  • Efficient heat dissipation
  • Universal suitable for large range of printer, just match the fan voltage and size

Kit Include:

  • Selected Voltage / Size / Style Fan + 2 Soldering Jacket + Zip Tie

Documentation:

https://support.dremc.com.au/en/support/solutions/articles/51000387053-how-to-replace-creality-toolhead-fan-universal-kit

Note: You will need to use heat gun or lighter and wire stripper. If you're not comfortable in this process, you can purchase our range of replacement fan suited for printer [Fan Collection] or Quick Connection Cable

Easy installation in just 3 steps

Installing the fan does not require disassembling the motherboard, wiring harness, etc., just changing the connecting wires.

  1. Prepare the stripped wires
  2. Plug the wires into the connectors
  3. Use a heat gun to heat the connectors so that they shrink and pull together tightly

Transparent heat shrink tubing

The transparent shrink tubing with a tin ring in the middle is ideal for connecting cables or wires and ensures that the fans can be changed quickly and easily. With a hot melt adhesive inside, the shrink tube is waterproof, leak-proof and temperature-resistant.

Efficient heat dissipation to accelerate cooling

The perfect heat dissipation makes the heat sink more efficient, prevents the print head from blocking, and ensures printing at full speed.

Attention: Please check the specifications of your original fan to be on the safe side, as small changes may be made between production series.

products.title: 2M Capricorn XS PTFE Tube 1.9mmx4mm for 3D Printers
products.body_html:
This Capricorn PTFE Tube is specifically designed for Ender 3 / 5 Series and CR10 Series 3D printers. Its precise 1.9mmx4mm size ensures a perfect fit in your 3D printer, and its 2m length ensures plenty of tubing for whatever 3D printing project you might have.

It measures 1.9mm (I.D.) x 4mm (O.D.) and works with all standard couplings for 1.75mm filaments.

  • Capricorn bowden Tube with high Temperature Resistance will operate at even higher temperatures
  • High lubricity additives makes it the lowest friction bowden tubing on the market.
  • 2 year warranty on Capricorn Teflon PTFE Tube 
  • It was developed specifically for 1.75mm filament

Product Includes: 

  • 1x 2m Capricorn XS

Product Specification :

  • Linear Thermal Expansions at 250c: 2.2-3.3%
  • Inner Diameter: 1.90 +/- 0.05
  • Outer Diameter: 3.95 +/- 0.05
  • Colour: Dark Blue
  • Suitable for Flexible Filament
  • Material: Pure Virgin PTFE /w Capricorn addictive mixture
  • DREMC Maximum recommended operating temperature: 200c (Consider all metal heat break/hotend if you desire printing above these temperature on PTFE hotend)
  • Maximum manufacturer temperature rating: 260c

Compatibility: 

For 3D Printer from extruder to the hotend. 

  • Fit for Creality 3D Ender 3,Ender 3 Pro,Ender 5,Ender 5 Plus,CR-10,CR-10S,CR-10S Pro,CR-10 V2,CR-20,CR-20 Pro and many more 3D Printers.

Documentation: 

Capricorn Safety Information: https://www.captubes.com/safety.html

 *Your Capricorn Premium PTFE Bowden tube is warranted for two years from the date of purchase. It is intended to be used as a Bowden tube for 3D printing, and any other use voids the warranty. If in the course of normal use, your Bowden tube fails due to a manufacturing defect within that time frame, please let us know. We will send you a replacement Bowden tube for postage cost.

Your PTFE Bowden tube is a precision instrument, and it can be damaged easily. Please handle it with care because kinks, cuts, abrasions, stretching, and crushing cannot be repaired. Damage to your Bowden tube due to misuse, negligence, loss, or theft is not covered by the warranty.

Acts of God, acts of dog, feline catastrophes, etc., are generally not covered.

products.title: E3D Revo™ Replacement HeaterCore (24v and 12v)
products.body_html:
The HeaterCore attaches to a Revo-compatible cold side with the included Revo HeaterCore spring. Once in place, simply screw on a Revo Nozzle to enable quick, tool-free nozzle changes without the need for hot tightening.

  • This heater warms significantly quicker than conventional heater blocks and offers enhanced safety features. Its positive temperature coefficient (PTC) design decreases power as temperature rises, minimizing risks during thermal runaway situations.
  • Designed to be compatible with a wide range of popular 3D printers, including models from Creality’s CR and Ender series, Prusa, Anet, Biqu, Monoprice, and others.
  • Discover comprehensive information about the Revo HeaterCore in E3D blog.

Please note: This product is available in either 12V or 24V. Please check your 3D printer’s power supply before purchasing to get the correct rated components.

What is Included:

products.title: Trianglelab CHCB-OT/OTC Hotend for K1 / Ender 3 v3 / Sprite Series
products.body_html:
The Trianglelab CHCB-OT Hotend is designed for optimal performance with K1, K1 Max, Ender 3 V3 KE/SE, V3, V3 Plus or the Sprite printers. This hotend features better reliability and ease of repairability compare to stock hotend. It also have open nozzle system, allow you use any MK8 nozzle. 

Note: Ensure you double check your K1/K1 Max, as some newer unit from 2024 are shipping with integrated(unicorn) nozzle/heat break. If that is case, select the "K1C" variant. Please note, not suitable for 2025 K1 series, please select the TL-CHCB-OTCV3. (Note: V3 is slightly longer wiring, if you have trouble cable manage wiring, contact us for assistant)

Features: 

  1. Planar contacts heating element have a more certain contact than ceramic heating  ring contacts
  2. Compared to the original, the OT/OTC hotend heating elements and thermistors are easy to maintain and replace, you can replace each component at time, compare to whole hotend assembly and reduce future maintenance cost.
  3. Separate design of fixed flange and heating core. The flange is made of a material with a low thermal conductivity to reduce the working temperature of the heat sink fixed with it by screws.
  4. Compatible with MK8 series nozzles, allow unified nozzle open sourced system with other Creality Printers. We recommenced pairing with Bontech CHT for higher flow.
  5. Drop-in replacement for the hotend of the Creality K1 /Creality K1 Max(2023) and CR-Sprite Hotend Printer. [Ensure you have selected correct selection] Note: For CR-M4, please select K1. [If un-sure please check listing photo of the connector size for your breakout board for your printer]
  6. Can be direct installed on Creality Sprite Extruder to increase flow rate by approx. 20-50% depending on nozzle size/filament and printing conditions and may require additional tuning.

What is Included:

(For Sprite Extruder)

Note: You will need to print 10mm CR Touch spacers (https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1Q0Tl5Mpb7j2PcIR5wGvP0xF2-RMFlPO5) or if you wish to keep 4010 you can print 4010 spacers and 3x M3x16mm fasteners for the 4020 fan. 

Note: Decrease Build Z Volume ~12mm for Sprite Hotend due to the larger part cooling fan and longer melt zone/hotend. Please ensure re-set your Z probe offset. 

  • Include 3D Printed fan shroud for 4020 (Printed by Trianglelabs, may be black or white colour in PETG)
  • 4020 Fan (Only for Sprite Extruder Kits)
  • CHCB-OT Hotend (Include Heater/Thermistor)
  • CR-6SE MK8 Style Brass Nozzle (0.4mm)
  • Spare Silicon Sock

(For K1 / K1 Max / V3)

(Support: Creality K1, K1 Max Ender 3 V3 SE*, Ender 3 V3 KE)

  • CHCB-OT Hotend (Include Heater/Thermistor)
  • CR-6SE MK8 Style Brass Nozzle (0.4mm)
  • Spare Silicon Sock

 (For K1C)

(Support: Creality K1C, K1 Max (2024))

  • CHCB-OT Hotend (Include Heater/Thermistor)
  • CR-6SE MK8 Style Brass Nozzle (0.4mm)

Revo Six Coldside

SKU: REVO-SIX-12V-COLD/REVO-SIX-24V-COLD 

Key features:

  • Drop in replacement for your existing V6 setup
  • Tool-free nozzle changes in under 60 seconds 

Description: 

It’s time to upgrade your existing V6 setup to unlock rapid, tool free nozzle changing with our latest technology, Revo. This Coldside kit includes a ready drop-in replacement Revo heatsink plus everything you need to securely mount the new setup to your printer. 

What is Included:

  • 1 x Revo Six Sink 
  • 1 x Collet 
  • 1 x Collet clip 
  • 1 x Heater Extension  
  • 1 x Thermistor Extension  
  • 1 x Fan duct 
  • 1 x 100mm PTFE 

Revo Prusa Mini Coldside 

SKU: REVO-MICRO-PMINI-COLD 

Key Features  

  • Drop in replacement for Prusa Mini/+
  • Fully compatible with stock Prusa Mini firmware, no need to PID tune after you upgrade!
  • Reuse your stock Prusa fan
  • Tool-free nozzle changes in under 60 seconds 

Description:  

Upgrade your Prusa Mini 3D printer with Revo to unlock rapid, tool free nozzle changing. This Coldside kit includes a Revo ready drop-in replacement heatsink plus everything you need to securely mount the new setup to your printer, including a 3D printed bracket. 

What is Included:

  • 1 x Collet 
  • 1 x Collet clip 
  • 1 x Heater Extension  
  • 1 x Thermistor Extension  
  • 1 x Revo Micro Sink  
  • 1 x 100mm PTFE 
  • 1 x Prusa Mini Bracket��
  • 2 x M3 Square nut 

Revo Prusa MK3/ MK3S/MK3S+ Coldside 

SKU: REVO-SIX-PRUSA-COLD 

Key Features 

  • Drop-in replacement for Prusa MK3
    • Continue to use your Prusa Slicer print profiles; no changes are required! 
  • Tool-free nozzle changes in under 60 seconds 

Description 

Upgrade your Prusa MK3 3D printer with Revo to unlock rapid, tool free nozzle changing. This Coldside kit includes a Revo ready drop-in replacement heatsink plus everything you need to securely mount the new setup to your printer. 

Do I need to change any firmware? 

Yes, there is a Revo specific version of prusa firmware that can be found here. 

What is Included:

  • 1 x Revo Six Heatsink 
  • 1 x Collet 
  • 1 x Collet clip 
  • 1 x Prusa MK3 Heater Cable 
  • 1 x Prusa MK3 Sensor Cable 
  • 1 x 100mm PTFE 

Voron Coldside 

SKU: REVO-VORON-COLD 

Key features 

  • Compatible with Voron 1, Voron Trident, Voron Switchwire, Voron 2.4, Voron Legacy, & Voron 0.1
  • Tool-free nozzle changes in under 60 seconds 
  • Super lightweight construction for improved speed performance
  • Pairs perfectly with the Voron StealthBurner

Description 

Upgrade your Voron 3D printer with Revo to unlock rapid, tool-free nozzle changing. Developed in collaboration with the Voron Design Team, this Coldside kit includes a Revo ready drop-in replacement heatsink plus everything you need to rigidly mount the new setup to your Voron printer. 

What is Included:

  • 1 x Voron Heatsink 
  • 1 x Heater extension  
  • 1 x Thermistor extension 
  • 1 x 100mm PTFE 

Creality Sprite Coldside 

SKU: REVO-CR-SPR-COLD 

Key features: 

  • Compatible with Creality 3 S1
  • Includes CR touch spacer and optimized part cooling fan shroud
  • Tool-free nozzle changes in under 60 seconds 

Description: 

Upgrade your Creality Ender 3 S1 with Revo to unlock rapid, tool free nozzle changing. This Coldside kit includes a Revo ready drop-in replacement heatsink plus everything you need to mount the new setup to your Ender 3 S1 printer. Pair with our Creality specific Starter Pack to start experimenting with the 2 most popular brass nozzles within minutes. 

What is Included:

  • 2 x M2 x 6 Self tapping screws 
  • 2 x M3x12 Socket head screws 
  • 1 x Crealty Sprite Revo Adaptor 
  • 1 x Creality Sprite Fan Duct 
  • 1 x Z-probe spacer 

Creality Coldside 

SKU: REVO-CR-COLD 

Key features 

  • Compatible with Creality Ender 3, Ender 3s, Ender 3 Pro, Ender v2, Ender 5, Ender 5 Pro, Ender 5 Plus, Ender 6, Ender 2 Pro, CR10, CR10S, CR10 S4, CR10 S5 & CR20 Mini
  • Tool-free nozzle changes in under 60 seconds 

Description 

Upgrade your Creality printer (please check compatibility list) with Revo to unlock rapid, tool free nozzle changing. This Coldside kit includes a Revo ready drop-in replacement heatsink plus everything you need to mount the new setup to your Creality printer. Pair with our Creality specific Starter Pack to begin experimenting with the 2 most popular brass nozzles within minutes. 

What is Included:

  • 1 x Creality heatsink 
  • 1 x 5 pack butt-splice connectors 
  • 1 x Heater extension  
  • 1 x Thermistor extension 

LGX Coldside 

SKU: REVO-LGX-COLD-D 

Description 

Revo LGX is a world-class extrusion system, thanks to the powerful combination of Revo Micro and Bondtech's LGX extruder. Revo Micro ensures smooth and consistent filament flow, resulting in high-quality prints with every use. Its lightweight and compact design provides excellent thermal performance, reducing heat-up times and preventing heat creep, even during prolonged printing sessions.  

Bondtech’s LGX Extruder is renowned for its large-gear design that delivers outstanding torque and precision. This extruder is built to handle a wide range of filament types and provides excellent grip, ensuring flawless and reliable filament feeding. The LGX Extruder's robust construction means smooth filament delivery, reducing the risk of clogs and improving overall print quality.  

What is Included:

  • 1 x LGX Extruder 
  • 1 x 5v Fan 
  • 1 x Bowden clip 
  • 1 x Metal Bowden collet  
  • 1 x Heater cable 
  • 1 x Sensor cable 
  • 1 x Revo Micro Heatsink 
  • 1 x 5v Regulator board 
  • 1 x Fan cable 
  • 1 x LGX adaptor 
  • 1 x Bowden tubing
